Nestled within the historic backdrop of Downtown Jacksonville, Brentwood Golf Course carries a rich legacy dating back to its establishment in 1923. Originally part of the bustling city center, the land was repurposed into a picturesque golfing oasis, featuring undulating fairways and meticulously manicured greens. The course's association with the PGA Tour, particularly the hosting of the Jacksonville Open in the mid-20th century, further cements its status as a landmark in Florida's golfing heritage. As a 9-hole course, Brentwood Golf Course offers a convenient option for golfers seeking a shorter round, perfect for those with limited time or looking to squeeze in a quick game. Whether you're a seasoned golfer seeking a challenging round or a newcomer eager to experience a piece of golfing history, Brentwood Golf Course promises an unforgettable day on the links. Brentwood Country Club | Head Golf Professional Search this site Embedded Files Skip to main content Skip to navigation Brentwood Country Club | Head Golf Professional Brentwood Country Club Brentwood, TN Head Golf Professional ABOUT THE CLUB Brentwood, TN | Located between Nashville and Franklin in beautiful Brentwood, Tennessee, Brentwood Country Club is Middle Tennessee’s most family-friendly club with a welcoming membership. The goal of the club is to provide the most accessible golf course and modern amenities to meet Golf and Social members' individual needs, keeping service and a pleasant member experience at the forefront. Brentwood Country Club has a long and interesting history. The 215 acre property was once part of the antebellum Midway Plantation owned by Lysander McGavock and his wife Elizabeth Crockett.  During the Civil War, the property was occupied by armies - from both sides. The McGavock's large brick house still stands today, preserved and renovated it serves as the clubhouse for Brentwood Country Club. In 1955, construction began on the 18-hole golf course that now serves as the centerpiece of the country club. Today, Brentwood Country Club is a thriving, vibrant club with 475 full members, and an extended waiting list.  The golf course embarked on an extensive, complete renovation project in the fall of 2022 under the direction of noted golf course architect, Bill Bergin. The course is scheduled to reopen in the fall of 2023. The current professional, Johnny Bridgeman, PGA is a decorated and accomplished golf professional and one of only two professionals to serve at Brentwood Country Club since 1955. Johnny will be retiring in the fall of 2023, after serving at the club for nearly 40 years. The club is seeking the right golf professional to succeed Johnny and take Brentwood forward for the next 30+ years. THE OPPORTUNITY PGA Head Golf Professional Brentwood Country Club is seeking a Head Golf Professional with experience working in a high service, private club environment with a proven record of success leading a golf operations team. The Head Professional will work closely with the Club’s General Manager to develop and implement all golf-related activities and programs  including: Merchandising Club Tournaments and Outings Instructional and Player Development Programs Staff Leadership and Development The position requires a friendly and outgoing personality with the ability to professionally interact with members, guests and outing coordinators. The ability to communicate effectively with all of the Club’s constituents (members, guests, staff and management team) is a required skill. The Head Golf Professional will be responsible for the detailed operation of all aspects of the golf course operation. The Head Golf Professional reports to the General Manager. Primary Responsibilities Responsible for the overall performance of golf shop operations and golf services creating a team environment Manage annual projects defined by the General Manager and evaluate/measure their success Continuously review and develop standard operating procedures for each area of the golf business to ensure maximum member satisfaction Responsible for the care and maintenance of all physical assets, inventory and resources of the golf facility Develop, implement and maintain health and safety procedures that comply with standards and legislation. Ensure these are clearly communicated to all staff and regularly reviewed Ability to develop and promote innovative programs to generate interest and maximize participation Direct all golf activities including daily management responsibilities Successfully train staff and management in a high service environment Outstanding business skills associated with financial reporting, generating return on investment, maximizing revenues, budget development and expense management Operational Responsibilities When possible, play golf with members of all skill levels to generate member participation and enthusiasm Organize and conduct club and inter-club tournaments and golf related events to drive member participation and satisfaction Interpret and enforce “The Rules of Golf” among members and staff Cooperate and collaborate with the grounds superintendent regarding maintenance issues that affect the playability of the golf course Coordinate Golf Department Food and Beverage needs with the Food and Beverage department to ensure service is executed effectively Enforce and recommend rules pertaining to the golf operations Manage labor costs daily/weekly/monthly to maintain labor costs in line with operating budget without compromising the service provided to the members Participate and assist in the development of short and long range plans for improvements to the club facilities and courses Provide golf-related information for the Club’s newsletter and website that is friendly, enthusiastic and promotes play and goodwill within the golf community Manage and facilitate new golf member orientation programs Interpersonal Responsibilities Select, supervise, train and evaluate performance of pro shop, outside service staff and assistant professional employees Provide effective leadership for the golf operations team giving directions to all managers and staff motivating and supporting them to achieve the Club’s vision and objectives Ensure all members of the golf operations team have appropriate opportunities to develop skills, knowledge and experience to enhance their performance Design, develop, deliver and monitor learning and development activities for the members and golf staff team to promote continuous training and improvement Ensure that all employees in the golf business consistently deliver excellent customer service, thereby achieving maximum member satisfaction Financial Responsibilities Provide monthly reports on financial performance, stock control, and utilization of facilities, sales and marketing activity to assess the success of the operation on an ongoing manner Participate in capital expense budgets to support the achievement of Club objectives Establish, monitor and analyze the operations budget and take prompt corrective actions to address variances and deficiencies to ensure each operating area is maximizing efficiency and profitability Achieve revenue and contribution targets for each aspect of the golf business Marketing and Member Services Identify and develop innovative programs for members including tournaments, social events and external promotions while ensuring that all activity is properly structured, communicated and executed Establish, implement and review effective marketing strategies to maximize results and ROE (return on experience) Identify and develop value added products and services to enhance the member experience PREFERRED ATTRIBUTES & QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree is highly preferred Class “A” PGA member in good standing Minimum of 3 years experience in a Head Professional/Director of Golf position preferred 5+ years of private club experience required Requires a flexible schedule to include but not limited to evening hours, weekends and holidays Excellent written & verbal communication skills Must be organized, efficient and detail oriented Excellent interpersonal/relationship skills a must Strong computer skills – point of sale software, tee sheet management software, word processing and spreadsheet software BRENTWOOD, TENNESSEE Brentwood, Tennessee , a suburb of Nashville located directly south from the city , is considered one of the most desirable suburban locations in the Southeast. Home to one of Livability.com’s Top 10 Libraries for Children, the city is also known for its strong business community and high standard of living. With 50 schools in Brentwood (includes private schools), there is no shortage of excellent education. Many of these schools are highly ranked with Scales Elementary, Brentwood Middle School and Brentwood High School being just one set of top tiered schools in the area. The area was originally home to farmland, and it’s kept that expansive and beautiful open space feel over time. Like many areas surrounding Nashville, Brentwood has seen a lot of growth in recent years. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS Competitive salary, commensurate with experience.  Additionally, the following benefits apply: Full benefits package (medical, dental, vision, short term disability, and life insurance) 401k plan with company match Paid time off Meals while on duty Clothing allowance Cell Phone allowance PGA Dues Playing & Practicing Privileges APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS All applications MUST be submitted through the PGA of America's Career Services Department as described below.
